definition.title: What Makes Social Posts Perform?
definition.content: High-performing social posts have three elements: a strong hook that stops the scroll, valuable content that earns engagement, and a clear call-to-action that drives interaction. Format matters too—write for how people actually read on each platform.

tips: Lead with the hook - the first line determines if anyone reads the rest
One idea per post - don't try to cover everything; depth beats breadth
Write for scanning - use line breaks, short sentences, and white space
End with engagement - ask a question or invite a specific response

faq.question: Which platform should I focus on?
faq.answer: Focus on where your audience is. LinkedIn for B2B, Instagram for lifestyle, Twitter for tech and news, Facebook for communities.

faq.question: How often should I post?
faq.answer: Consistency matters more than frequency. 3-5 times per week on most platforms is a good target for most professionals.

faq.question: Should I use the same content across platforms?
faq.answer: Adapt the content for each platform. Same message, different format and tone. Use the Content Repurposer for this.

faq.question: What makes a post go viral?
faq.answer: Strong hooks, emotional resonance, unique perspectives, and shareability. Focus on providing value, not chasing virality.
